articles.title: Student's pug first U.S. dog to test positive for COVID-19 - The Dartmouth
articles.description: It seems that even man’s best friend can’t escape the pandemic.Winston the pug, owned by Ben McLean ’22 and his family, tested positive for COVID-19 on April 24, making him the first dog in the U.S. to test positive for the coronavirus.
articles.content:

articles.author: Kate Whiting
articles.title: COVID-19: How did Spanish flu change the world? - World Economic Forum
articles.description: Author Laura Spinney explains how the Spanish Flu pandemic of 1918-19 changed society and how its lessons could help fight coronavirus 100 years later.
articles.content:
• Over three waves of infections, the Spanish flu killed around 50 million people between 1918 and 1919.
  • Science journalist Laura Spinney studied the pandemic for her 2018 book Pale Rider: The Spanish Flu of 1918 and How It Changed the World.
